document_title: Low placenta: Causes, signs, treatment and prevention
subsection_title: nhau bam thap.json. Method for diagnosing low-lying placenta
subsection_data:
nhau bam thap.json. Method for diagnosing low-lying placenta
Currently, to diagnose low placenta during pregnancy, doctors will perform an ultrasound to check. Usually warning signs of this condition often appear during fetal ultrasound from 20 weeks of age. About 10% of cases will develop into complete placenta previa.
To diagnose low placenta, the obstetrician will perform one of the following three methods:
Vaginal ultrasound;; Abdominal ultrasound;; Magnetic resonance imaging;
